notes: Removed Shambhala-specific references and URLs from titles/descriptions.

bio.es: Erudito clave del movimiento Rimé; renovó el estudio monástico en el este del Tíbet y estableció un currículo centrado en los grandes tratados clásicos de India.

extendedProps.description: The anniversery of Terton Sogyal (1856-1926). He is discussed in many of our books including The Life and Times of Jamyang Khyentse Chokyi Lodro which related the following:Of Chokyi Lodros many gurus one of the most important was Terton Sogyal. After Patrul Rinpoche passed away Terton Sogyal became a student of Khyentse Wangpo from whom he received many empowerments reading transmissions and pith instructions. Khyentse Wangpo teased and scolded Terton Sogyal a great deal; he hardly ever praised him. After the great terton had moved to Nyakrong where he established his monastery Khyentse Wangpo started calling him Nyakrong Nakrama-dreadlocked black man from Nyakrong. (I think he called him Nakrama because Terton Sogyal had such a dark complexion.) For the majority of his life Terton Sogyal traveled freely around the country as a wandering ascetic. Khyentse Wangpo by contrast directed a vast number of activities and held a position that brought with it enormous merit power and wealth. Yet he too signed many of his writings Manjugosha the Wanderer. Terton Sogyal couldnt understand it at all. Eventually he asked Khyentse Wangpo directly how he of all people could truly describe himself as a wanderer. Its not something you will understand right now replied Khyentse Wangpo. Go to central Tibet towards the end of your life. Then youll understand. As things turned out Terton Sogyal did eventually go to Lhasa. It was there that he became the guru of many of Tibets highest lamas including His Holiness Thubten Gyatso the Thirteenth Dalai Lama and preceptor of the Tibetan government. As Khyentse Wangpo had predicted in the midst of his new and very busy schedule the great terton came to realize how Khyentse Wangpo had truthfully been able to describe himself as a lifelong wanderer and ascetic. In spite of all his responsibilities Khyentse Wangpo had always practiced the Dharma and never indulged in the games worldly people play. For example he never even attempted to be tactful or politically shrewd yet he was held in the highest esteem by great masters scholars members of the aristocracy politicians and the rich. As a result of this realization Terton Sogyal developed even greater confidence in him. I dont know the details or fully understand why but at one of Khyentse Wangpos seats broken samaya caused Terton Sogyal to become so ill that he could barely move. Chokyi Lodro immediately He instructed Dzongsar Monastery to recite Samayavajra and many hundred thousand Vajrasattva mantras promising offerings for the recitations from the donations he collected. He made more offerings to the very best Dzongsar monks asking them to accumulate one hundred thousand Vajrasattva mantras each and even recited a large number himself. As a result Terton Sogyal recovered completely and is known to have declared that he owed Chokyi Lodro a tremendous debt of gratitude. Chokyi Lodro always said that Terton Sogyal was one of his root gurus. They were very close.

After the great terton had moved to Nyakrong where he established his monastery Khyentse Wangpo started calling him Nyakrong Nakrama-dreadlocked black man from Nyakrong. (I think he called him Nakrama because Terton Sogyal had such a dark complexion.) For the majority of his life Terton Sogyal traveled freely around the country as a wandering ascetic. Go to central Tibet towards the end of your life. Then youll understand. As things turned out Terton Sogyal did eventually go to Lhasa. As Khyentse Wangpo had predicted in the midst of his new and very busy schedule the great terton came to realize how Khyentse Wangpo had truthfully been able to describe himself as a lifelong wanderer and ascetic. In spite of all his responsibilities Khyentse Wangpo had always practiced the Dharma and never indulged in the games worldly people play. For example he never even attempted to be tactful or politically shrewd yet he was held in the highest esteem by great masters scholars members of the aristocracy politicians and the rich. As a result of this realization Terton Sogyal developed even greater confidence in him. I dont know the details or fully understand why but at one of Khyentse Wangpos seats broken samaya caused Terton Sogyal to become so ill that he could barely move. Chokyi Lodro always said that Terton Sogyal was one of his root gurus. They were very close.

event.title: Anniversary of the First Dodrubchen Rinpoche

extendedProps.description: Aniversario de First Dodrubchen Rinpoche. En el calendario lunar tibetano se observa el día 13 del mes 1. La fecha en el calendario occidental varía cada año.

entries.titleEn: Anniversary of the First Dodrubchen Rinpoche
entries.descriptionEs: Aniversario de First Dodrubchen Rinpoche. En el calendario lunar tibetano se observa el día 13 del mes 1. La fecha en el calendario occidental varía cada año.

bio.es: Gran maestro nyingma del linaje de Dodrupchen, asociado a la transmisión de Dzogchen y a la consolidación de la tradición en torno a su monasterio.

extendedProps.description: Aniversario de Milarepa. En el calendario lunar tibetano se observa el día 14 del mes 1. La fecha en el calendario occidental varía cada año.

entries.descriptionEs: Aniversario de Milarepa. En el calendario lunar tibetano se observa el día 14 del mes 1. La fecha en el calendario occidental varía cada año.

bio.es: Yogui y poeta del linaje Kagyu, célebre por sus “cantos” de realización y por la transmisión de instrucciones de meditación como el mahamudra.

bio.es: Traductor (lotsawa) y maestro tibetano que trajo y transmitió enseñanzas vajrayana de India (especialmente de Nāropa), fundador temprano del linaje Kagyu en el Tíbet.

bio.es: Maestro rimé del siglo XIX, gran tertön y compilador; impulsó una transmisión no sectaria reuniendo y preservando linajes y enseñanzas de múltiples escuelas.

bio.es: 11.º titular del trono de Palyul (Nyingma); maestro influyente que expandió centros y formación monástica, preservando la transmisión del linaje Palyul.

extendedProps.description: Aniversario de Terdak Lingpa. En el calendario lunar tibetano se observa el día 2 del mes 2. La fecha en el calendario occidental varía cada año.

bio.es: Revelador de tesoros (tertön) y fundador de Mindrolling, uno de los grandes monasterios nyingma; figura decisiva para el desarrollo de ritual, liturgia y enseñanza en Nyingma.

bio.es: Erudito gelug y fundador/figura principal de Labrang; reconocido por sus aportes al estudio filosófico y la consolidación de instituciones monásticas en Amdo.

bio.es: Maestro nyingma asociado a la difusión de Dzogchen en Occidente; conocido por su enseñanza directa y por sostener linajes de práctica y retiro.

extendedProps.description: Aniversario de Do Khyentse. En el calendario lunar tibetano se observa el día 20 del mes 2. La fecha en el calendario occidental varía cada año.

bio.es: Maestro nyingma del siglo XIX, ligado al movimiento Rimé; reconocido por su realización y su influencia como maestro itinerante y no convencional.

bio.es: Maestro kagyu del linaje Shangpa/Karma Kagyu, conocido por introducir retiros de tres años y por la difusión internacional de práctica y enseñanza.

event.title: Anniversaries of Kohn Konchog Gyalpo and Sachen Kunga Nyingpo

extendedProps.description: The 14th day of the ninth month marks the anniverseries of two of the most important figures in the Sakya Tradition: Kohn Konchok Gyalpo and Sachen Kunga Nyingpo. The latter has several works included in the Sakya volume of the Treasury of Precious Instructions (including The Verse Summary of the Topics of the Commentary of the Precious Oral Intimate Instruction; The Nyakma Commentary: A Commentary on The Vajra Verses the Treatise of the Path with Its Result the Precious Oral Instruction. Both of them are profiled in Treasures of the Sakya Tradition (

bio.es: Maestro indio que influyó decisivamente en el budismo tibetano; su obra y enseñanza inspiraron el enfoque kadam y el desarrollo del lamrim.

extendedProps.description: Lha Bab Duchen the Buddhas descent from Tushita after going there to teach his mother Maya falls on the 22nd day of the ninth month.. Tushita or the heaven of the thirty-three is located in the desire realm of the earth dwelling gods and this realm is commonly depicted as the uppermost heaven in the Wheel of Life painting. The name thirty-three is derived from the heaven of the great sky god Indra and his thirty-two subsidiary gods or ministers. In the Indian traditions this number is often multiplied by a million to correspond to the vast pantheon of different gods which are said to number thirty-three million. --From The Encyclopedia of Tibetan Symbols and Motifs?src=googlecal&rand=72218

The name thirty-three is derived from the heaven of the great sky god Indra and his thirty-two subsidiary gods or ministers. extendedProps.description: Aniversario de Kyabje Dudjom Rinpoche. En el calendario lunar tibetano se observa el día 18 del mes 11. La fecha en el calendario occidental varía cada año.

bio.es: Cabeza de la escuela Nyingma en el siglo XX; gran tertön y autor de una influyente historia de la tradición Nyingma, además de textos y prácticas.

extendedProps.description: Aniversario de Chatral Rinpoche. En el calendario lunar tibetano se observa el día 20 del mes 11. La fecha en el calendario occidental varía cada año.

entries.descriptionEs: Aniversario de Chatral Rinpoche. En el calendario lunar tibetano se observa el día 20 del mes 11. La fecha en el calendario occidental varía cada año.

bio.es: Maestro nyingma/dzogchen conocido por su vida de retiro y ética estricta; influyente transmisor de Dzogchen y prácticas de Guru Rinpoché.

extendedProps.description: Aniversario de Chogyal Phakpa. En el calendario lunar tibetano se observa el día 22 del mes 11. La fecha en el calendario occidental varía cada año.

entries.descriptionEs: Aniversario de Chogyal Phakpa. En el calendario lunar tibetano se observa el día 22 del mes 11. La fecha en el calendario occidental varía cada año.

bio.es: Maestro Sakya del siglo XIII; figura clave en la relación Sakya–Imperio Yuan y en la difusión institucional del budismo tibetano.

event.title: Anniversary of the Fourth Dodrubchen Rinpoche

extendedProps.description: Aniversario de Fourth Dodrubchen Rinpoche. En el calendario lunar tibetano se observa el día 23 del mes 11. La fecha en el calendario occidental varía cada año.

entries.titleEn: Anniversary of the Fourth Dodrubchen Rinpoche
entries.descriptionEs: Aniversario de Fourth Dodrubchen Rinpoche. En el calendario lunar tibetano se observa el día 23 del mes 11. La fecha en el calendario occidental varía cada año.

bio.es: Maestro nyingma del linaje de Dodrupchen; reconocido por su erudición y su papel en sostener y transmitir prácticas y estudios del linaje.
